name: Royal Anchor Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is not your typical OOB hotel. The beach in Old orchard is fabulous but most of the hotels are sub-par, Royal Anchor is the exception. The rooms are clean and well cared for. The staff is extremely accommodating. The location is wonderful with most of the rooms having views of the ocean. As far as we are concerned, this is the only hotel in Old Orchard Beach.
reviews.title: Clean, quiet, great staff, great location...all we could want and more.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Royal anchor is your typical motel. It is cleaner than any place else I have stayed in OOB. If pastries are your thing for breakfast the breakfast bar is good and plentiful. The only concern I had was the lack of air conditioning. But it worked out ok it wasn't really hot or humid during our stay. The beach is great and the staff were really very friendly and we enjoyed our room. We will deffinately go back. Parking was also very handy right outside our door.
reviews.title: Most Enjoyable

reviews.text: My family and I greatly enjoyed our trip to OOB and especially our stay at the Royal Anchor! Everything was just as it should be during a relaxing vacation! Delicious breakfasts, helpful staff, beautiful beach views from our balcony, clean rooms, and a heated pool! The Royal Anchor is at the perfect spot right on the beach and is also situated very close to local attractions. It was definitely worth the trip from Florida! This place is a keeper and a great value! We can't wait to go back!!
reviews.title: Remarkable

reviews.text: I must say that my stay at the Royal Anchor was quite enjoyable. This was my first time here and I will definitely be returning. The rooms were very clean and the pool was so nice and warm. The ocean front was such a treat and the weather was surprisingly beautiful all week. I give the service 110% . I will suggest this resort to anyone who comes across it. Anyone who says that they will NEVER AGAIN come to this resort is out of their mind crazy, and clearly just looking for something to complain about.
reviews.title: Wonderful and very welcoming Resort!!!!

reviews.text: I've been staying at the Royal Anchor since my honeymoon in Oct 1974. My husband has since passed away, but I still go there every October. I loved the beautiful view from the balcony, walks on the beach , the quiet and solitude of OOB in the fall. I have never had a bad time while at the Royal Anchor--friendly & cooperative staff, lovely rooms, and clean . I recommend staying here to anyone looking for an enjoyable and relaxing vacation. I wouldn't sat antwhere else! Gail from NH
reviews.title: Been staying here since 1974-wouldn't stay anywhere else!
Stuck in 1975
reviews.text: I was very surprised to get a key when we checked in – a key, not a keycard like almost every other hotel I’ve stayed at in the last 20 years. This was particularly problematic, because the lock was really tricky; we struggled with it every time we needed to get in.

reviews.title: Best place to stay in Old Orchard Beach
reviews.text: When we first checked in, there was sand on the floor (we didn't track it in) – did no one vacuum? The bed was like sleeping on jell-o, every time someone moved even the tiniest bit the whole thing shook. There were a lot of bugs; the furniture was shabby; the electric sockets were loose and our plugs sometimes fell out. And when I called and asked if they had wi-fi, they said yes, but neglected to mention that it’s available in the common areas, NOT in every room (some rooms get lucky). I was really disappointed.

reviews.title: Clean & relaxing overnight
reviews.text: On the upside, the shower was nice and the employees were friendly enough. Our relatives stayed across the street at the Grand Beach Inn and I thought that was nicer. I wouldn’t stay here again.

reviews.title: Wonderful Beach Front
reviews.text: Stayed here for a weekend during the height of the 2009 summer season (almost $300 per night after taxes). Was well worth it. Decent sized room on the top floor with a balcony facing the ocean. The place was very clean and offered a great setting for couples and families. The pool is large, very clean and heated. The beach is connected to the property - no need to cross a road or anything else. The front end staff was pleasant. Each room is given one free on site parking spot. This section of OOB is about 10 mins walking from the main "pier" area. THIS IS THE PLACE TO STAY!!! There is NO street noise here (unlike hotels closer to the pier) and your section of the beach is always empty and much cleaner. The place looks dumpy from the street but is actually very nice inside. There was a small but usable fridge inside the room. No internet service but my laptop was able to feed off of the free wireless service provided by the OceanWalk hotel from inside our room (reliable signal all 3 nights). This hotel is an excellent choice for pretty much anyone outside of the spring break crowd.

reviews.title: People are nice, but wouldn't stay again
reviews.text: I stayed here overnight with my sister in law after dropping my son off at UNE College for his visit. the rooms were small but everything was just right. The views were great as were the folk that greeted us and gave good recommendations on were to eat. . If my son goes to this college i will be back at the royal anchor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I called only a month in advance to make reservations as it was a last minute idea. When I asked for an Ocean view the woman on the phone told me I was all set and charged my card the full price for section A. When we got to the hotel we were stuck in section C. Right next to the lobby with absolutely no privacy but, yet they would not refund my money! Oh yeah another great thing we got to experience was the lack of A/C! That was a real treat. The staff was accommodating IF you were the only one they were working with. Otherwise it takes them forever to help you even if you only need to ask 1 simple question. I can not stand the fact that they only have 1 person at the front desk during peak season. Absolutely ridiculous! I will NEVER stay here again.
reviews.title: Never Again

reviews.text: Get up in the morning and enjoy the free continental breakfast by the pool or near the beach. Walk down the stairs and right onto the beach. Safe, secure family environment. Close, yet not too close to the boardwalk. Convenient location to activities, malls, shopping. Friendly staff. Well managed. Very well maintained. We have stayed there several times and have never been disappointed. Will be there again next week. This is the best value in the Old Orchard Beach area and we have been going there for decades.
reviews.title: Best Value we have found in Old Orchard Beach

reviews.text: We just returned from the Royal Anchor Resort and were so pleased with the accomodations. The room was very clean, the service was great, the view from the balcony was wonderful! The beach was just beautiful. What really impressed us was how quiet the rooms are. Although the weather didn't cooperate, we had a wonderful, relaxing vacation. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Definitely will return.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, great service, awesome view!

reviews.text: owners, Mark and Claire, quickly quieted a loud group one night. the place is immaculate; staff is ALWAYS doing some type of cleaning. staff is friendly and very accommodating. excellent parking situation.
reviews.title: very clean and quiet; friendly atmosphere. easy access parking.

reviews.text: We arrived at the Royal Anchor Resort in OOB on a rainy day in May as part of our 2 week tour of New England from the UK with our 8 year old son. Check-in was efficient and the price good. We also took advantage of their guest laundry room which was a boon at the halfway stage in our trip.
reviews.title: RAR -e find in OOB

reviews.text: Very nice, very clean, right on beach, spectacluar views from room, heated pool is a treat, continental breakfast was good. Refrig & Keuring coffee machines in the room a treat (bring your own k kups for more variety). Hotel is Not within walking distance to pier/ amusement park, especially with kids, but that may be a plus for some. Generally I was very happy with our stay here, if I did have to comment on some improvements it would be that it needs some updating, exterior paint, outdoor carpeting needs replacing, stairwells flooded during one (very) rainy day. Lounge chairs in pool area would be nice, options are BYO or sit on the grass. I have stayed at other hotels in this price range which provided towels in the pooi area. Needs more seating room in breakfast area. Also no wifi, managed to connect via the hotel next door.
reviews.title: Very nice, but could be better for the price

reviews.text: One comment on something not directly related to the hotel -the trolley to get around OOB - costs $1 per person each way, if you have more than 2 people you mgiht as well just drive and pay the parking (parking fee goes down to $5 in the afternoons).
reviews.title: Clean but old

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was wonderful but the hotel needs updating. The beds and some furniture are old and uncomfortable. The room could have been better for the price we paid.
reviews.title: Can't Wait To Go Again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we discovered Royal Anchor we had no idea that we would return every year!
reviews.title: Our home away from home

reviews.text: We had tried two vacations at other motels before we found ROR and found there is no comparison! Clean,safe and friendly service. Each time we go we try to find new adventures. The historic signifigance of the area is wonderful.
reviews.title: By far the best value in Old Orchard Beach

aka: Royal Anchor Hotel Old Orchard Beach
